Hi Gordon,

Thanks for the quick response.  I got the error, it's more because of 
the robots.txt so instead of giving -9998 it gave me -2. In any case I 
could not have been able to crawl it. I need to have different way to 
get those crawled.

Regarding the Illegal CharacterSet Exception, I am crawling few european 
pages which have other encodings other than UTF-8.
one such example would be ( from the logs/runtime-errors.log)


2008-09-16T10:24:35.905Z    -5       7149 
http://www.gotamobi.com/amember/signup.php - - text/html #020 
20080916102434525+1376 sha1:45DW6AQM2PCN5J73GGWPAEFGKMMRRXFP - 
err=java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException
 java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException:
        at java.nio.charset.Charset.checkName(Charset.java:274)
        at java.nio.charset.Charset.lookup2(Charset.java:459)
        at java.nio.charset.Charset.lookup(Charset.java:438)
        at java.nio.charset.Charset.forName(Charset.java:503)
        at 
org.archive.io.RecordingOutputStream.getReplayCharSequence(RecordingOutputStream.java:532)
        at 
org.archive.io.RecordingOutputStream.getReplayCharSequence(RecordingOutputStream.java:516)
        at

        at

        at 
org.archive.modules.extractor.Extractor.innerProcess(Extractor.java:81)

org.archive.modules.Processor.innerProcessResult(Processor.java:157)
        at org.archive.modules.Processor.process(Processor.java:123)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:310)
        at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:157)

SEVERE: Problem java.nio.charset.UnsupportedCharsetException:

--Thanks and Regards
Vaijanath

Gordon Mohr wrote:
> Crawl.log status codes are described here:
>
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/glossary.html#statuscodes
>
> The '-2' indicates some sort of connection error -- such as the server 
> not accepting the TCP connection, or dropping it. You may learn more 
> in the local-errors.log but this is most likely an issue on the target 
> server, not your configuration. (Unless, you've done something like 
> aggressive crawling which has caused them to block you.)
>
> I would need more details to know what's happening with the 
> IllegalCharacterSet exception, and whether there's anything that can 
> be done to address it.
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
> Vaijanath N. Rao wrote:
>> Hi All,
>>
>> I have Heritrix 2.0 and we have written an writer Processor which 
>> writes into mysql DB instead of the Arc Writer Processor.
>> I am trying to build an multi-lingual search index and for the same 
>> reason I was crawling some sites other than English.
>>
